title: What is the importance of Philippine history as a subject? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you don’t study history properly then lies and misinformation could spread easily… So how could you defend yourself if you don’t know how to argue? Proper understanding of history would be able to put many things in context. If you know how to argue, then no one could humiliate you. I see a lot of people spreading lies or misinformation about the ancient natives as being “barbaric savages” until Europeans arrived, this is one of the reasons why Filipinos need to study history properly. Dayang C Marikit's answer to What are some remarkable ancient civilizations most people don't know about?

This question has been asked in various ways MANY MANY times before on Quora. Just search for “Philippine history” and you’ll find more answers than you probably have time to read - and you won’t waste the time of others in repetition. FWIW, my answer to one of these previous versions is here: What is the importance of the Philippines’ history to students?
